abstract: John Minchillo was losing sight of the context for his photography - or perhaps, starting out, he had yet to find it. The work of Ed Kashi from India, and his own experience there, changed his mindset.
snippet: John Minchillo was losing sight of the context for his photography - or perhaps, starting out, he had yet to find it. The work of Ed Kashi from India, and his own experience there, changed his mindset.
lead_paragraph: John Minchillo, 26, was born in New Rochelle, N.Y., and studied English literature and political science at SUNY Binghamton. He was working as a writer when he picked up a camera, and upon graduation was offered a job as a staff photojournalist at a local newspaper, The Scarsdale Inquirer.
